titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Newtown poll records 1978.178
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-22 17:44:24 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The collection contains poll lists for District 2, Newtown, Queens, on November 4, 1879, certified by James W. Smith, Clerk. The poll list includes voter names.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Newtown was the original name by which the Queens neighborhood of Elmhurst was once known. The first European settlement in what is now Queens county was at Maspeth, but was abandoned in 1644. In 1652 another settlement was formed, at first named Middlburgh and renamed Hastings in 1664, but often referred to as the "new town" to distinguish it from the earlier Maspeth settlement. The English made the name Newtown official in 1683 as part of establishing a system of towns and counties. Real estate promotoer Cord Meyer II developed an area north of Newtown in 1895-1896. Not wanting his development to be associated with the pollution of nearby Newtown Creek, he pushed for the area to be renamed Elmhurst.

list.head: Source:
list.item: Seyfried, Vincent. "Newtown." In The Encyclopedia of New York City, edited by Kenneth T. Jackson, 906. New Haven, Conn.: Yale University Press; New York: New-York Historical Society, 2010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Newtown poll records, 1879, 1978.178, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Newtown, Queens County public road bond 1977.519
Edward Tompkins and Thomas Way farm agreement and receipt 1977.365
Jonathan Howard and Nicholas Anderson deed 1977.043

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains poll lists for District 2, Newtown, Queens, on November 4, 1879, certified by James W. Smith, Clerk. The poll list includes voter names.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
